title: The effect of ownership and regulation on British railway performance, 1850-2006
abstractText:
We want to answer the following questions

  • How fast was a representative bundle of British passenger trains at various times 1843-2006?
  • How good is this performance in a European context?
  • How valuable has the increase in speed been to passengers over that time?
  • What proportion of the increase has come from new technology, from investment, and from incentives?
  • Would greater investment have passed social cost-benefit analysis, and, if so, what was the welfare loss from not investing in faster services?
  • What can we learn from history about effective railway regulation and incentives?
  • What policy lessons can we learn as a result?
  • How much has the standard of living increased as a result of faster transport?
organisation: London School of Economics & Pol Sci
